intro: Polygala guimaraensii, commonly known as the Guimaraens' milkvetch, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with distinctive, spurred petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
